result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A Vyse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle A Vyse is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle A Vyse was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $543 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
1:26 PM Defendant Kyle A Vyse in court with Attorney Kira Leigh Visser.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Counts #1 and 3. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2
-All CC, DNA surcharge, DA surcharge and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-The Court orders DNA sample

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H.
Defn appeared in person with Atty Visser. ADA Nelson appeared in person. Set for STC in approx 90days with possibility to change to Plea/Sent Hearing; NIH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Kira Leigh Visser by defn
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Kim V. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AMV except only as allowed by Family Court. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:04 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
